newsitem.title: USA: MGE SPRING WHEAT ENDS MIXED, SEPT CONTINUES RALLY.
newsitem.headline: MGE SPRING WHEAT ENDS MIXED, SEPT CONTINUES RALLY.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures settled mixed, but the nearby September contract continued its recent strong performance amid worries over the Canadian spring wheat crop, traders said.
Sept spring wheat continued to firm after news that the Canadian Wheat Board pegged this year's wheat crop in western Canada at 21.6 million tonnes, lower than many had expected.

Despite the continued strength seen Friday in the Sept contract, spring wheat did not post the kinds of gains seen in Chicago and Kansas City. Traders blamed the relative softness on hedge pressure tied to the current harvest.
"Our December lost about six cents (per bushel) against Chicago's December... and it may have been due to harvest pressure," a MGE trader said.
U.S. wheat markets also gained Friday on spillover strength from CBOT corn and soybeans, which settled broadly higher despite lower opening calls tied to bearish crop estimates by Conrad Leslie-ADM.
MGE spring wheat closed 1/4 cent per bushel lower to 2-3/4 cents higher, with nearby Sept up 2-3/4 cents at $3.97-3/4.
